item.title: April add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description: "War is what happens when language fails." -- Margaret Atwood

item.title: April add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description: "A word after a word after a word is power." -- Margaret Atwood

item.title: April add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description: "There's an epigram tacked to my office bulletin board, pinched from a magazine -- "Wanting to meet an author because you like his work is like wanting to meet a duck because you like pâté." -- Margaret Atwood

item.title: April add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description: "Don't let the bastards grind you down." -- Margaret Atwood

item.title: April add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description: "Perhaps I write for no one. Perhaps for the same person children are writing for when they scrawl their names in the snow." -- Margaret Atwood

item.title: April add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: April add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "If you liked being a teenager, there's something really wrong with you." -- Stephen King

item.title: April add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "I think that we're all mentally ill. Those of us outside the asylums only hide it a little better - and maybe not all that much better after all." -- Stephen King

item.title: April add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "Sometimes being a bitch is all a woman's got to hold on to." -- Stephen King

item.title: April add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "Alone. Yes, that's the key word, the most awful word in the English tongue. Murder doesn't hold a candle to it and hell is only a poor synonym." -- Stephen King

item.title: April add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "There's no bitch on earth like a mother frightened for her kids." -- Stephen King

item.title: April add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "Schizoid behavior is a pretty common thing in children. It's accepted, because all we adults have this unspoken agreement that children are lunatics." -- Stephen King

item.title: April add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "The beauty of religious mania is that it has the power to explain everything. Once God (or Satan) is accepted as the first cause of everything which happens in the mortal world, nothing is left to chance...logic can be happily tossed out the window." -- Stephen King

item.title: April add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "For every minute you are angry you lose sixty seconds of happiness." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: April add a quote by Winston S. Churchill
item.description: "Courage is what it takes to stand up and speak; courage is also what it takes to sit down and listen." -- Winston S. Churchill

item.title: April add a quote by Marthe Troly-Curtin
item.description: "Time you enjoy wasting is not wasted time." -- Marthe Troly-Curtin

item.title: April add a quote by Angelina Jolie
item.description: "When other little girls wanted to be ballet dancers, I kind of wanted to be a vampire." -- Angelina Jolie

item.title: April add a quote by Andre Gide
item.description: "Believe those who are seeking the truth. Doubt those who find it." -- Andre Gide

item.title: April add a quote by Truman Capote
item.description: "Failure is the condiment that gives success its flavor." -- Truman Capote

item.title: April add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "In the depth of winter, I finally learned that within me there lay an invincible summer." -- Albert Camus

item.title: April add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "It does not do to dwell on dreams and forget to live." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: April add a quote by Elie Wiesel
item.description: "The opposite of love is not hate, it's indifference. The opposite of art is not ugliness, it's indifference. The opposite of faith is not heresy, it's indifference. And the opposite of life is not death, it's indifference." -- Elie Wiesel

item.title: April add a quote by Stieg Larsson
item.description: "She went around with the attitude that she would rather be beaten to death than take any shit." -- Stieg Larsson

item.title: April add a quote by Bertolt Brecht
item.description: "Hungry man, reach for the book: it is a weapon." -- Bertolt Brecht

item.title: April add a quote by Harper Lee
item.description: "Until I feared I would lose it, I never loved to read. One does not love breathing." -- Harper Lee

item.title: April add a quote by William Ralph Inge
item.description: "It is useless for the sheep to pass resolutions in favor of vegetarianism, while the wolf remains of a different opinion." -- William Ralph Inge

item.title: April add a quote by Ambrose Bierce
item.description: "Love, n. A temporary insanity curable by marriage." -- Ambrose Bierce

item.title: April add a quote by Mawlana Jalal-al-Din Rumi
item.description: "The minute I heard my first love story, I started looking for you, not knowing how blind that was. Lovers don't finally meet somewhere. They're in each other all along." -- Mawlana Jalal-al-Din Rumi

item.title: April add a quote by Rumi
item.description: "Sell your cleverness and buy bewilderment." -- Rumi

item.title: April add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "There is nothing I would not do for those who are really my friends. I have no notion of loving people by halves, it is not my nature." -- Jane Austen
